message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of our premium product with you. I believe it's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. As we're just starting our conversation, I'm willing to make a competitive offer to get us off on the right foot. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1,400,000. What do you think?
Hello Alice, thanks for the offer. While I agree your product is impressive, that price point is a bit high for me. I'd be willing to purchase the product for $1,050,000. Let me know what you think.

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the price, but I'm still confident that our product will bring significant value to your business. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $1,250,000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure I'll be able to go any lower. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you working with me on the price. That said, $1,250,000 is still a bit too high for my budget.  I could meet you at $1,125,000.  This offer represents a fair compromise, and I hope you'll consider it.

I understand that $1,125,000 is a compromise, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable going that low. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer the product to you for $1,200,000. This is my final offer, and I'm not sure I'll be able to go any lower. What do you think?
